                    ### Question
                    Starvation and diabetes mellitus can lead on to ketoacidosis which of the following features is in our of ketoacidosis due to diabetes mellitus.

                    ### Options
                    opa. Increase in glucagon/insulin ratio, increased CAMP and increased blood glucose
opb. Decreased insulin, increased free fatty acid which is equivalent to blood glucose
opc. Decreased insulin, increased free fatty acid which is not equivalent to blood glucose
opd. Elevated insulin and free fatty acid, equivalent to blood glucose

### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
In diabetes mellitus, decreased insulin action increases the glucagon/insulin ratio, promoting lipolysis and elevated free fatty acids, which are converted to ketone bodies, leading to ketoacidosis. Concurrently, increased cAMP enhances glucose production, raising blood glucose levels. This sequence aligns with the biochemical pathways activated during uncontrolled diabetes and is crucial for understanding the metabolic derangements leading to diabetic ketoacidosis.
